BabelShark::Subject

Detailed Description

Subject is base class for the observer pattern At this point it doesn't seem like any of the child subjects would need to change this functionality as its pretty standard, but the possibility exists.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BabelShark::Subject::Subject (  )  [inline]

Empty constructor since no construction needed.

BabelShark::Subject::~Subject (  )  [inline]

Empty destructor since no construction needed.

Member Function Documentation

void BabelShark::Subject::Attach ( Observer *  observer  ) 

Adds the observer to the list of observers so when the notify method is called we know they want to be notified

void BabelShark::Subject::Detach ( Observer *  observer  ) 

Removes the observer to the list of observers so when the notify method is called we know they no longer care about changes to the subject.

void BabelShark::Subject::Notify (  ) 

Perform the highly important job of notifying the observers in the list of observers.

Member Data Documentation

std::list<Observer*> BabelShark::Subject::_Observers [protected]

Objects who care when the subject changes.
